snippet: After decades of nearly uniform tribal support for Indian gambling, casino-owning tribes have emerged as some of the most powerful and dogged opponents of new Indian casinos.
abstract: Casino-owning Indian tribes have emerged as powerful and dogged opponents of new Indian casinos, bucking decades nearly uniform tribal support for Indian gambling; Chukchansi and Table Mountain tribes have spent more than $2 million to place question on California ballot about whether North Fork tribe should be allowed to build its casino; their campaign is one of first times tribes have turned to ballot box to fight another tribe's gambling plans.
lead_paragraph: After decades of nearly uniform tribal support for Indian gambling, casino-owning tribes have emerged as some of the most powerful and dogged opponents of new Indian casinos.

headline.main: Tribes Clash as Casinos Move Away From Home
headline.print_headline: Tribes Clash as Casinos Move Away From Home
